meanings.definition: The quality or state of being late or delayed.
meanings.sent1: Her tartiness in arriving at the party caused some inconvenience.
meanings.sent2: The train's tartiness made everyone late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Despite her usual punctuality, her tartiness that day was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The tartiness of the bus schedule threw off the entire day's plans.
meanings.sent5: The tartiness of the delivery was frustrating for the customer.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sharp or sour in taste.
meanings.sent1: The lemonade's tartiness made her pucker up.
meanings.sent2: The tartiness of the green apple was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tartiness of the yogurt caught her off guard.
meanings.sent4: The tartiness of the vinegar added a zing to the salad dressing.
meanings.sent5: The tartiness of the grapefruit woke up her taste buds.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sharp or cutting in manner or tone.
meanings.sent1: Her words had a tartiness that left him feeling stung.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's tartiness added humor to his jokes.
meanings.sent3: Despite the tartiness of his comment, she knew he meant well.
meanings.sent4: The tartiness of her criticism was softened by a smile.
meanings.sent5: His tartiness in response surprised everyone in the room.
